cs.ualberta.CMPUT301F14T08.stackunderflow

Class Answer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.ualberta.CMPUT301F14T08.stackunderflow.Post
      • cs.ualberta.CMPUT301F14T08.stackunderflow.Answer

  • public class Answer
extends Post
    Answer class, extends Post class. Used to hold answers to questions. mPartent ID will like an answer to a question. Answers should never be called with out calling setparentQuestion or it will cause an answer that is not answering anything
    Author:
    Cmput301 Winter 2014 Group 8

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Answer(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String signature)
      Constructor creates an answer for a question without a picture or a date, Default parent ID is set to null.
      Answer(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String signature, java.lang.String photo)
      Constructor creates an answer for a question without a date, Default parent ID is set to null.
      Answer(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String signature, java.lang.String photo, java.util.Date date)
      Constructor creates an answer for a question.

      Called on a answer to get the mParentID of the question that is the parent of that answer.

    • Method Detail

      • setParentQuestion

        public void setParentQuestion(Question parentQuestion)
        Called on a answer to set the inner variable mParentID to the ID of the question
        Parameters:
        parentQuestion - the question that is the parent of the question.

      • getParentID

        public java.util.UUID getParentID()
        Called on a answer to get the mParentID of the question that is the parent of that answer. Multiple answers can have a single question but but one answer cannot have multiple questions
        Returns:
        a Parent UUID of a question that his answer is the parent of.
